title: Volunteering Survey
question_text:
A local church wants to know how often people of the community volunteer. Pastors of the church visited $100$ randomly selected houses during the day and asked respondents approximately how many hours per month they perform volunteer work.
Which of the following bias(es) could be present in this study?
I. Undercoverage II. Nonresponse III. Response bias
solution:
Statement I is correct; undercoverage is present; the pastors will not be able to reach those people who work during the day or people who live in non-traditional homes (apartments, condos, etc..).

Statement II is correct; non-response could be present; subjects may choose not to answer the door when a stranger appears.

Statement III is correct; response bias could be present; people may lie about volunteering to make themselves look good.
